summary: This is an email summarizing a call between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Sternheim, Everdell, Cohen) and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding Maxwell's conditions of confinement at MDC Brooklyn and plans for a renewed bail application. The defense describes harsh, invasive treatment of Maxwell, including frequent strip searches, isolation, and COVID-19 exposure risks, comparing it unfavorably to treatment of other high-profile inmates. They also discuss sharing confidential financial and co-signer information for the bail package under a protective order.

events.title: Maxwell Forced into COVID-19 Quarantine
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was abruptly moved from her day area, threatened with 21 days in SHU if she refused a COVID-19 test, given two tests, and placed in an isolation cell after a staff member in her area tested positive.

events.title: Defense-Prosecution Call on Conditions and Bail
events.description: A call took place between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Sternheim, Everdell, Cohen) and Assistant U.S. Attorneys to discuss her deteriorating conditions of confinement at MDC and the defense's plans to file a renewed bail application.

events.title: Planned Meeting on Bail Application
events.description: The defense and prosecution planned to meet (ideally in person or by video) the following Monday to discuss the confidential details of the renewed bail package the defense had been preparing for 3.5 months.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys described her treatment at MDC Brooklyn as unprecedentedly harsh, involving constant surveillance, invasive strip searches, isolation, and conditions that posed a high risk of COVID-19 infection from staff.

The defense explicitly linked Maxwell's severe conditions of confinement to the death of Jeffrey Epstein, warning the government that if she became sick due to BOP actions, it would create 'another nightmare for the Government'.

The defense team had spent 3.5 months preparing a renewed bail application they believed addressed prior court and government concerns, and they sought to share the confidential financial and co-signer details under the existing protective order.

Attorney-client meetings for Maxwell were heavily surveilled, with cameras present and multiple guards watching, which the defense argued was an unprecedented invasion of the attorney-client relationship.
Maxwell was reported to be suffering physically and mentally from the conditions, with her hair falling out, though she was described as a 'mentally healthy person' being 'worn down'.
